The Carbon Capture & Storage Association (CCSA) estimated that the earlier CCS projects in the power sector would cost between €60–€90 per tonne of carbon dioxide abated, the equivalent of around $69-$103 per tonne.
The association also predicted that these costs will decline to €35–€50 ($40-$57) in the early 2020s, thanks to technological advancements.[https://www.power-technology.com/features/carbon-capture-cost/]

Carbon capture and storage is a technology that captures the carbon dioxide from burning fossil fuels before it is released to the atmosphere.[https://climate.mit.edu/ask-mit/how-efficient-carbon-capture-and-storage]
Most carbon capture technologies aim to stop at least 90% of the CO2 in smokestacks from reaching the atmosphere.[https://climate.mit.edu/ask-mit/how-efficient-carbon-capture-and-storage]
